test-case.description: analyze-string with empty string

test-case.description: analyze-string with empty sequence

test-case.name: analyzeString-002a
test-case.description: analyze-string with empty sequence

test-case.name: analyzeString-003
test-case.description: analyze-string with a mix of matching and non-matching strings

test-case.description: analyze-string with a single non-matching string

test-case.name: analyzeString-005
test-case.description: analyze-string with a single matching string

test-case.name: analyzeString-006
test-case.description: analyze-string with a adjacent matching strings

test-case.name: analyzeString-007
test-case.description: analyze-string with a single captured group

test-case.name: analyzeString-008
test-case.description: analyze-string with nested captured groups

test-case.name: analyzeString-009
test-case.description: analyze-string, groups in alternatives

test-case.name: analyzeString-010
test-case.description: analyze-string, with i flag

test-case.name: analyzeString-011
test-case.description: analyze-string, with i and x flag

test-case.name: analyzeString-012
test-case.description: analyze-string, with flags set to empty string

test-case.name: analyzeString-013
test-case.description: analyze-string, with "s" flag

result.assert-serialization: <fn:analyze-string-result xmlns:fn="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"><fn:match>Mary had a little lamb, it's fleece was black as soot, and everywhere that Mary went, it put its sooty foot</fn:match><fn:non-match>.</fn:non-match></fn:analyze-string-result>

test-case.name: analyzeString-014
test-case.description: analyze-string, multiple lines without "s" flag

any-of.assert-serialization: <fn:analyze-string-result xmlns:fn="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"><fn:match>Mary had a little lamb,</fn:match><fn:non-match> </fn:non-match><fn:match>it's fleece was black as soot,</fn:match><fn:non-match> </fn:non-match><fn:match>and everywhere that Mary went,</fn:match><fn:non-match> </fn:non-match><fn:match>it put its sooty foot.</fn:match></fn:analyze-string-result>

test-case.name: analyzeString-015
test-case.description: analyze-string, multiple lines with "m" flag

any-of.assert-serialization: <fn:analyze-string-result xmlns:fn="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"><fn:match>Mary had a little lamb,</fn:match><fn:non-match> </fn:non-match><fn:match>it's fleece was black as soot,</fn:match><fn:non-match> </fn:non-match><fn:match>and everywhere that Mary went,</fn:match><fn:non-match> </fn:non-match><fn:match>it put its sooty foot.</fn:match></fn:analyze-string-result>

test-case.name: analyzeString-016
test-case.description: analyze-string, multiple lines with "m" flag

any-of.assert-serialization: <fn:analyze-string-result xmlns:fn="http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions"><fn:non-match>Mary had a little lamb, it's fleece was black as soot, and everywhere that Mary went, it put its sooty foot.</fn:non-match></fn:analyze-string-result>

test-case.name: analyzeString-017
test-case.description: subtle distinction in the positioning of an empty captured group

test-case.name: analyzeString-017a
test-case.description: subtle distinction in the positioning of an empty captured group

test-case.name: analyzeString-018
test-case.description: non-capturing group indicated by "(?:...)"

test-case.name: analyzeString-019
test-case.description: "q" flag suppresses grouping

test-case.name: analyzeString-020
test-case.description: test typing of result of analyze-string: with no import-schema
test-case.test: let $result := analyze-string("banana", "(b)(anana)") return ($result//@nr)[1] instance of attribute(nr, xs:positiveInteger)

test-case.name: analyzeString-021
test-case.description: test typing of result of analyze-string: with no import-schema
test-case.test: let $result := analyze-string("banana", "(b)(anana)") return $result instance of element(*, xs:untyped)

test-case.name: analyzeString-022
test-case.description: test string value of result of analyze-string

test-case.name: analyzeString-023
test-case.description: test string value of result of analyze-string

test-case.name: analyzeString-024
test-case.description: test typed value of result of analyze-string: referencing a name defined in the schema

test-case.name: analyzeString-901
test-case.description: analyze-string, error, bad regex pattern

test-case.name: analyzeString-902
test-case.description: analyze-string, error, bad flags

test-case.name: analyzeString-903
test-case.description: analyze-string, error, pattern matches a zero-length string
